DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value to represent the number of metastatic lung nodules removed during a surgical procedure. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another._Relating to the lungs._A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:Relating to the lungs.:A small aggregation of cells. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs._A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue._Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs.:A small aggregation of cells. -- 2003:Removed; taken out of or separated from.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.
Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.
Determining the number or amount of something.
